Title: New Orleans attack: 'Vehicle bombs' have a long history and all are not terrorism
Description: While vehicular attacks, such as the one in New Orleans on the New Year's Day, can be traced to 1960s, such attacks surged after 2014 when jihadist groups like the Islamic State began to promote them and, with the surge of far-right in 2016 in the West, far-right and other extremist movements also adopted the tactic

Title: Switzerland burqa ban law comes into effect 4 years after referendum nod
Description: The burqa ban is part of the new constitutional article which calls for the probation of covering the face. The federal authorities stated that the violation of the law would be dealt with through the administrative fine procedure to minimise bureaucracy

Title: Boat tragedy off Libya coast, 20 missing as survivors narrate harrowing experience
Description: The boat carried 27 passengers and left Zuwara in Libya at 10 pm on December 30. The mishap occurred in the rough sea waters after waves tilted the boat. Despite this, seven people managed to travel on the vessel before the Italian coast guard found them on December 31

Title: Trump 2.0 trade risks dampen mood in Asian factories, soften expectations for 2025
Description: US President-elect Donald Trump will make his return in the White House on January 20. However, his pledge to impose tariffs on imports from some countries have already soured the mood of Asian factories

Title: Mass shooting at New York night club, at least 11 injured as police converge on crime scene
Description: At least 11 people have been injured in a mass shooting near the Amazura event hall at 91-12 144th Place in Jamaica, within the 103rd Precinct, around 11:20 pm on January 1

Title: South Korea's impeached Prez Yoon Suk Yeol resists arrest for third day, vows to 'fight' authorities
Description: South Korean impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol resisted arrest for a third day on Thursday. He had, on December 3, declared martial law that led to his impeachment and has left him facing arrest, imprisonment or, at worst, the death penalty

Title: South Korea police raid Muan airport, Jeju Air office over Boeing plane crash that killed 179
Description: South Korea police on Thursday carried out a search and seizure operation at three locations, including Muan airport, Jeju Air office in Seoul, and a regional aviation office to 'swiftly and rigorously determine the cause and responsibility' for the plane crash on December 29 that killed 179 people

Title: Balochistan human rights group accuses Pakistani forces of abducting 18 people & conducting violent raids
Description: The Baloch Yakjehti Committee (BYC), a leading human rights group in Balochistan, accused the Pakistani military of abducting 18 people and causing rampage across the province

Title: From France to Israel, global condemnation & condolences pour in over the New Orleans attack
Description: New Orleans was initially founded by colonists from France and the attack took place in the Louisiana city's famed French Quarter

Title: 45 YO man goes on a shooting spree in Montenegro, kills 10
Description: 10 killled and four were injured after a 45-year-old man went on a shooting spree following a bar brawl in Montenegro. The gunman died from injuries, the authorities said

Title: Yoav Gallant, former Israeli defence minister, quits parliament
Description: Gallant had often broken ranks with Netanyahu and his coalition allies of far-right and religious parties, including over exemptions granted to ultra-Orthodox Jewish men from serving in the conscript military

Title: Gaza population declines 6% amid ongoing conflict: Palestinian statistics bureau
Description: The population of Gaza has fallen 6% since the war with Israel began nearly 15 months ago as about 100,000 Palestinians left the enclave while more than 55,000 are presumed dead, according to the Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics (PCBS)

Title: Italy's financial capital enforces strictest anti-smoking law: Bans smoking on streets, crowded public spaces
Description: The latest measure, effective January 1, prohibits smoking in 'all public spaces, including streets,' with the exception of places where smokers can maintain at least a 10-meter (33-foot) distance from others
